search_information.query_displayed: Sex Stereotypes of Secondary School Teaching Subjects: Male and Female Status Gains and Losses Simpson, Richard L. Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: Sex stereotypes of secondary school teaching subjects: Male and female status gains and losses
organic_results.snippet: A survey revealed that teachers considered different subjects more appropriately taught by men or by women. In evaluating prestige of teachers of different subjects, they attributed higher prestige to whichever sex conformed to the subjects' sex stereotypes. Prestige attributions to men and women teachers, considered separately, varied with sex appropriateness of their subjects. Nonconformists appeared to avoid adverse effects on satisfaction by denying the stereotypes. Men's prestige varied more than women's with …

publication_info.summary: RL Simpson - Sociology of Education, 1974 - JSTOR
